junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> Another common case you'll want to test is w=
here you use more
> type-specific constructors. For instance, a TimeExcepti=
on class might
> have getTime() and setTime() methods, and constructors tha=
t take a
> Date object as well as a string. These need to be tested.
> Furt=
hermore, if the detail message is changed depending on the extra
> typed da=
ta you passed in, then getMessage(), printStackTrace() and
> some other dep=
endent methods may need to be tested as well.

I'm not sure I would test th=
ose, simply because it's not critical for the
functioning of the software, =
but "just" debugging information. Might just be
me being lazy, though.

Che=
